channel.title: What's a 317?
channel.description: OK, first off, I know what a 317 is, it's a server/client with crappy & bad graphics. But I want to know like, where that came from. I mean why is a 317 server called a 317? How come they're not 316s or 217s? Is there like some program that gives u a number of how good your graphics are or something? This question just popped in to my head and it's really been bugging me

item.title: What's a 317?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:7, topic:291907”][quote author=_ikram link=topic=385722.msg2892411#msg2892411 date=1248982437]

It’s the client revision. It’s like what “version” it’s on. Current runescape is in the five hundreds.

545 to be exact <3
[/quote]
554*[/quote]

huh. Thought I saw a 549 out there like 2 weeks ago o.O

Read full topic

[/quote]

554*

It’s the client revision. It’s like what “version” it’s on. Current runescape is in the five hundreds.

item.title: What's a 317?
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

[quote=“SonGoku, post:3, topic:291907”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=385722.msg2892298#msg2892298 date=1248978349]
cache revisions
[/quote]

No. The cache has no single number for versions. It uses CRC tables for the files inside it.

317 is the client revision.[/quote]

Exactley, The cache always updates, they /we call it 317 because when the client revision updates (the cache obvioulsy too) it too keep a track mainley.

Read full topic

item.title: What's a 317?
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

The Soul:

cache revisions

No. The cache has no single number for versions. It uses CRC tables for the files inside it.

317 is the client revision.

Read full topic
